title: Firefox causing memory leak on my site
content:
Hi All, urgently I need your attention to this matter. I’m the owner of a website. I’ve been facing a strange issue that only happens in Firefox with my site https://fbox.click/.

The site uses WebAssembly modules for video playback and some dynamic features. On Firefox, after a few minutes of browsing or watching, the page starts lagging badly, and sometimes the tab crashes or freezes. This doesn’t happen on Chrome or Edge at all.

I reached out to my hosting provider to check if there’s any server-side issue, but they confirmed everything is fine, no resource limits, no errors in logs, and no unusual traffic spikes. I also checked my code and there’s no infinite loop or heavy script running.

It looks like Firefox is not handling the WebAssembly memory properly. Maybe it’s not releasing memory or something is leaking during playback. I even tried disabling extensions and running in private mode, but the issue still happens randomly.

Is this a known bug or something I can fix from my side? I’d really appreciate any help or guidance.

Thanks.
creator: felipewhite

title: Site not loading properly on Firefox – works fine on other browsers
content:
Hi Mozilla Support,

I run a movie streaming site called https://fbox.click/, and recently I’ve noticed a strange issue that only happens on Firefox.

The site loads perfectly on Chrome, Edge, and Safari. But on Firefox, some users (including me) are seeing broken layout, missing images, and sometimes the video player doesn’t show up at all. It’s random sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn’t.

I contacted my hosting provider to check if there’s any server-side issue, but they confirmed everything is working fine on their end. No errors in logs, no firewall blocks, and the SSL is valid.

I also cleared cache, disabled extensions, and tested in private mode but the issue still happens. It seems like Firefox is either blocking some resources or failing to render certain parts of the site properly.

Can someone help me figure out what’s going wrong? Is there any known bug or setting in Firefox that could cause this kind of behavior?

Thanks in advance!

Ali

title: Master Your Studies with Expert Help for Online Classes
content:
In today’s fast-paced world, balancing education with work, family, and personal responsibilities can feel overwhelming. Online learning has become a convenient way to pursue degrees and certifications, but it often comes with its own challenges—tight deadlines, complex assignments, and endless discussions that can quickly pile up. Many students find themselves struggling to keep pace, leading to stress, lower grades, and burnout. That’s why professional academic support has become an essential resource for learners who want to succeed without sacrificing their well-being.

If you’ve ever wondered, “Can someone do my online class for me?—the answer is yes, and you’re not alone. Countless students seek expert assistance to stay on top of their coursework while managing other commitments. By hiring reliable professionals, you ensure that your assignments, quizzes, exams, and discussion posts are handled with precision and care. This not only helps boost your grades but also frees up valuable time that you can dedicate to your career, family, or personal growth. When you choose a trusted service to “do my online class,” you’re investing in peace of mind and academic success. The goal isn’t just to get the work done but to create a smooth, stress-free learning experience where you can focus on what truly matters in your life.

Ultimately, online education is meant to empower you, not overwhelm you. With expert academic support, you can strike the perfect balance between learning and living. Whether you’re a working professional aiming for a promotion, a parent juggling multiple responsibilities, or a student simply looking to reduce stress, these services are designed to help you thrive. Don’t let the weight of deadlines and pressure hold you back—take control of your education today and achieve the success you deserve.
creator: ameliaa.smithh123

title: AI chatbots login issue
content:
Hi Mozilla community,

I’ve run into an issue that’s getting a bit frustrating, and I’m hoping someone here might be able to help. Whenever I use AI chatbots (like ChatGPT or similar) and then close my browser, I find that I have to log in all over again the next time I open it. This happens every single time I restart the browser, and it's starting to disrupt my workflow. I’ve already checked my Firefox settings — things like cookie behavior and privacy options — but I still can’t seem to get the sessions to persist. I’m not using private browsing, and I haven’t set it to clear history or cookies on exit (at least as far as I can tell). Could this be related to a specific setting I’ve missed, or is it just how Firefox handles session data for these kinds of sites? Any tips or guidance would be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance!
creator: mikem69955

title: Take my online class
content:
Online education has revolutionized how people learn, offering unmatched flexibility and access to courses from top institutions worldwide. Whether you're pursuing a degree, earning a certification, or simply gaining new skills, online classes allow you to study at your own pace and on your own schedule. However, the convenience of online learning can also come with its own challenges—such as staying motivated, managing time effectively, and juggling multiple responsibilities.

For these reasons, many students search for support services with requests like, “take my online class.” This phrase often refers to hiring expert help to manage course assignments, quizzes, discussion posts, or even entire classes. These services are especially popular among working professionals, parents, or students enrolled in multiple programs who struggle to keep up with demanding coursework. While it's important to maintain academic integrity, some learners turn to these services as a temporary solution during particularly overwhelming times.

title: Firefox jumps to top of page after I select a checkbox and search results refresh
content: Greetings, On cargurus website for example there are many filters which contain multiple checkboxes each. If I scroll down to a section and select a checkbox, the results refresh and takes me back to the top of the page. The problem is that sometimes I want to select more than one checkbox in a filter or choose checkboxes in the next filter to select a checkbox. When I search for cars I may end up selecting more than 10 filter checkboxes to get the results I want. If I have to scroll back down to where I left off each time, it takes a lot of time to run a query. This jumping to the top does not happen using Chrome, so there must be something in firefox that can be adjusted but I cannot find it. I only used Cargurus as an example, but it happens on all sites with checkboxes. Keep in mind I am not a programmer so I don't know how to add code to websites or firefox settings. Thank you, Mark Sufka

title: Firefox browser not working properly
content: Hello. Yesterday when I started my PC, the Firefox browser wouldn't restore my previous session. This has of course happened before, so I restarted, but that didn't help. So then I have to restore all the pages myself, boring. BUT, when firefox doesn't remember any of my usual pages, I'm starting to worry. Then I think I want to update Firefox, and that's when I discover my main problem.....I can't access the menu in the three symbols at the top right (shown in the picture/attachment). I can't open my profile, can't open extensions, can't download anything or open the downloads icon, and most importantly, CAN NOT open the "Open application menu" (the icon with three horizontal lines), so THEN I have a big problem. The menu bar and everything there is available, but without access to "Open application menu" I can't reinstall Firefox. I can't save bookmarks either, or see if the bookmarks are in a backup or something. So, I don't dare delete firefox, then reinstall it, without knowing if I'll find my bookmarks again. I've tried saving them to a file, but I've never heard of a JSON file, and I don't know how to process it. I should also add that I deleted all my AVAST anti virus programs and files two days ago. And I have found out that I do have the latest firefox update. Hope someone can help me or give me some tips. I'm not particularly computer savvy either, just so you know. And I'm norwegian :) Thanx, Bendik.

title: "No Video with Supported Format and MIME Type Found" On
content:
As the title says. I get this prompt on videos from different, yet particular websites and sources. And they fail to load. It's also happened where some video's work and some don't, side-by-side on the same website and session.

  • I've tried clearing all of my cached data, my browser history, cookies, site-data, settings, and fill-out information. No avail.
  • I've tried disabling all of my extensions and add-ons.
  • I've even tried using google instead, but I just get constant loading on those particular video's with no thumbnail (As depicted in second picture).
  • I've checked my video drivers for updates.
  • I've tried reinstalling Adobe Flash Player, even though it says it's no longer supported.

Since it also might be happening in another browser. I understand how this might not be Firefox's fault. But I'm hoping you'll be able to help me still.
